Natural products provide a great opportunity for the development of new drugs, particularly antimicrobials. Essential oils can be a valuable source for discovering their antibacterial attributes against multidrug-resistant pathogens.
1 Essential oils are volatile aromatic components that are obtained from different parts of plants including buds, seeds, roots, leaves, stems, woods, barks, and flowers.
2 Since ancient times, essential oils have been known for their biological effects and have been extensively appraised against different biological purposes and other pharmaceutical applications.
